onboarding.subject: Urban Gardening for Small Spaces
onboarding.summary: Wants to learn how to start a productive garden in a small apartment balcony space.

profiling.focus_areas: container gardening, vertical planters, herbs, easy vegetables
profiling.notes: Learner lives in an apartment with a small balcony.

course_structure.title: The Balcony Harvest: Practical Urban Gardening for Small Spaces

phases.title: Assessing Your Micro-Climate
phases.description: You will be able to evaluate your balcony's light, wind, and weight capacity to select the right location for your plants.

lessons.title: Map Your Sunlight and Shadow Patterns
lessons.description: Learn how to track sunlight hours to determine if your balcony is full-sun, partial, or shade.
lessons.instructional_seed: Assume total beginner level. Teach how to use a phone's compass and a simple 'light journal' to map shadows, emphasizing that urban buildings create unique micro-climates.

lessons.title: Manage Wind and Weight Constraints
lessons.description: Understand the safety and structural limits of apartment balconies for heavy pots and soil.
lessons.instructional_seed: Address the safety concerns of 'wind tunnels' in high-rises and explain how to calculate the weight of wet soil to ensure balcony safety.

phases.title: The Urban Container Kit
phases.description: You will be able to select the ideal pots, vertical systems, and specialized soil for productive container gardening.

lessons.title: Choose High-Performance Containers
lessons.description: Compare terracotta, plastic, and smart self-watering pots for small-space efficiency.
lessons.instructional_seed: Focus on drainage and size requirements for different vegetables. Introduce self-watering planters as a solution for busy apartment dwellers.

lessons.title: Go Green Vertically
lessons.description: Utilize wall space and railings with pocket planters and vertical shelving.
lessons.instructional_seed: Provide practical installation ideas for apartment-friendly vertical systems that don't require permanent drilling into exterior walls.

lessons.title: Mix the Perfect Container Soil
lessons.description: Learn why garden soil fails in pots and how to create a lightweight, nutrient-rich potting mix.
lessons.instructional_seed: Deep dive into the 'soilless' mix concept using peat/coir, perlite, and compost. Explain aeration and water retention in the context of limited pot volume.

phases.title: High-Yield Plants for Tiny Spaces
phases.description: You will be able to select and plant specific herbs and vegetables that thrive in restricted environments.

lessons.title: Grow a Culinary Herb Garden
lessons.description: Start with high-success herbs like basil, mint, and chives that provide immediate utility.
lessons.instructional_seed: Focus on the 'cut and come again' method. Explain which herbs can share a pot (rosemary/thyme) and which must be solo (mint).

lessons.title: Plant Compact Vegetables and Leafy Greens
lessons.description: Select 'patio' variety tomatoes, peppers, and salad greens designed for containers.
lessons.instructional_seed: Explain 'determinate' vs 'indeterminate' varieties. Focus on high-yield, small-footprint crops like radishes and bush-variety beans.

phases.title: Maintenance and Trouble-Shooting
phases.description: You will be able to keep your garden alive through proper watering, feeding, and pest management.

lessons.title: Master Apartment Watering and Drainage
lessons.description: Learn to water efficiently without flooding your neighbors below.
lessons.instructional_seed: Focus on 'deep watering' and the use of saucers. Explain how to check soil moisture using the finger-test method.

lessons.title: Identify and Solve Common Urban Pest Issues
lessons.description: Spot aphids, gnats, and mold early using organic, kitchen-safe methods.
lessons.instructional_seed: Keep solutions practical and non-toxic for a living space. Teach the use of neem oil and soapy water sprays.

lessons.title: Feed Your Plants in Containers
lessons.description: Understand the lifecycle of nutrients in limited soil and when to fertilize.
lessons.instructional_seed: Teach the basics of liquid N-P-K fertilizers and the timing for feeding 'heavy feeders' like tomatoes vs. light feeders like herbs.
